new kind of mindmap running a dragAndDroppable experiment

name: Human AI Net
short_description: New kind of mindmap based on reordering and connecting between lists using drag-and-drop with the mouse, a way to organize any kind of ideas really fast and intuitively. Data format is a plain text file containing those lists, each with its own name which appear in other lists as you shape it like your mind. Run any Java class in top center of window by writing javaclass://the.package.ClassName anywhere in a definition, but only if you check the "allow file to run code" box. Integrated with artificial intelligence (AI) data structures including bayesaddr (piece of a bayesian network), boltzaddr (piece of a boltzmann machine), listaddr (list of any items in the system including other addr types), and other things you would find in an AI framework, designed for ease of use by anyone. Its about how we think. Version 0.7.0 has issues with square brackets in definitions and Java events, to be fixed soon. Its a framework for research toward general intelligence. I needed a way to organize it
summary: New kind of mindmap based on drag-and-drop between lists, code, and AI
